verses.text: The word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles ;

Against Egypt , against the army of Pharaoh-necho king of Egypt , which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish , which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.
Order ye the buckler and shield , and draw near to battle.
Harness the horses ; and get up , ye horsemen , and stand forth with \add your\add* helmets ; furbish the spears , \add and\add* put on the brigandines.

Wherefore have I seen them dismayed \add and\add* turned away back ? and their mighty ones are beaten down , and are fled apace , and look not back : \add for\add* fear \add was\add* round about , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 46.5 \ft beaten…: Heb. broken in pieces\f*\f + \fr 46.5 \ft fled…: Heb. fled a flight\f*
Let not the swift flee away , nor the mighty man escape ; they shall stumble , and fall toward the north by the river Euphrates.
Who \add is\add* this \add that\add* cometh up as a flood , whose waters are moved as the rivers ?

Egypt riseth up like a flood , and \add his\add* waters are moved like the rivers ; and he saith , I will go up , \add and\add* will cover the earth ; I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.

Come up , ye horses ; and rage , ye chariots ; and let the mighty men come forth ; the Ethiopians and the Libyans , that handle the shield ; and the Lydians , that handle \add and\add* bend the bow.\f + \fr 46.9 \ft the Ethiopians: Heb. Cush\f*\f + \fr 46.9 \ft the Libyans: Heb. Put\f*

For this \add is\add* the day of the Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d* of hosts , a day of vengeance , that he may avenge him of his adversaries : and the sword shall devour , and it shall be satiate and made drunk with their blood : for the Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d* of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

Go up into Gilead , and take balm , O virgin , the daughter of Egypt : in vain shalt thou use many medicines ; \add for\add* thou shalt not be cured.\f + \fr 46.11 \ft thou shalt…: Heb. no cure shall be unto thee\f* \p
The nations have heard of thy shame , and thy cry hath filled the land : for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty , \add and\add* they are fallen both together. \p
¶ The word that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake to Jeremiah the prophet , how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come \add and\add* smite the land of Egypt.
Declare ye in Egypt , and publish in Migdol , and publish in Noph and in Tahpanhes : say ye, Stand fast , and prepare thee; for the sword shall devour round about thee.
Why are thy valiant \add men\add* swept away ? they stood not, because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* did drive them.

He made many to fall , yea, one fell upon another : and they said , Arise , and let us go again to our own people , and to the land of our nativity , from the oppressing sword.\f + \fr 46.16 \ft made…: Heb. multiplied the faller\f*
They did cry there, Pharaoh king of Egypt \add is but\add* a noise ; he hath passed the time appointed.

\add As\add* I live , saith the King , whose name \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , Surely as Tabor \add is\add* among the mountains , and as Carmel by the sea , \add so\add* shall he come.

O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt , furnish thyself to go into captivity : for Noph shall be waste and desolate without an inhabitant.\f + \fr 46.19 \ft furnish…: Heb. make thee instruments of captivity\f*
Egypt \add is like\add* a very fair heifer , \add but\add* destruction cometh ; it cometh out of the north.

Also her hired men \add are\add* in the midst of her like fatted bullocks ; for they also are turned back , \add and\add* are fled away together : they did not stand , because the day of their calamity was come upon them, \add and\add* the time of their visitation.\f + \fr 46.21 \ft fatted…: Heb. bullocks of the stall\f*
The voice thereof shall go like a serpent ; for they shall march with an army , and come against her with axes , as hewers of wood.
They shall cut down her forest , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, though it cannot be searched ; because they are more than the grasshoppers , and \add are\add* innumerable.
The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded ; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel , saith ; Behold, I will punish the multitude of No , and Pharaoh , and Egypt , with their gods , and their kings ; even Pharaoh , and \add all\add* them that trust in him:\f + \fr 46.25 \ft multitude: or, nourisher: Heb. Amon\f*

And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives , and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon , and into the hand of his servants : and afterward it shall be inhabited , as in the days of old , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ But fear not thou, O my servant Jacob , and be not dismayed , O Israel : for, behold, I will save thee from afar off , and thy seed from the land of their captivity ; and Jacob shall return , and be in rest and at ease , and none shall make \add him\add* afraid.

Fear thou not, O Jacob my servant , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for I \add am\add* with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but correct thee in measure ; yet will I not leave thee wholly unpunished.\f + \fr 46.28 \ft not leave…: or, not utterly cut thee off\f*
